long:
Meaning: properly, to "rub" to pieces or pulverize; intransitively, to "disappear" as dust; also to "salt" whether internally (to "season" with salt) or externally (to "rub" with salt).
Usage: Ã— at all, salt, season, temper together, vanish away.
Source: a primitive root; also as denominative from "H4417"
